results.title: Barry and the psycho doorstop salesman
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This work depicts an animated character, Barry, bored with commercial television. He happily accepts a video game sold to him by an overzealous door to door salesman. Barry becomes enraged when he finds that the game does not work and complains to the salesman the following day. Barry has made a big mistake…as the psychotic salesman stalks Barry and a violent tussle ensues in the dead of night. Barry finally finishes killing the salesman…or has he??

group_siblings.title: The Adventures of Buzz Boy & Buzz Girl
Would you like gravy with that?

results.title: The Adventures of Buzz Boy & Buzz Girl
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This animated short depicts the adventures between an evil bee and super hero insects. Dr. Bee has hypnotised Buzz Boy to steal for him, after poisoning a peanut and jelly sandwich. Buzz Girl finds out the truth and informs Buzz Boy. Together they set out in search of Dr.Bee. They find him and are caught up in a high speed chase which eventuates in Dr.Bee crashing into the side of a skyscraper.

results.title: [Tom Hughes]
results.brief_description:
An old pirate sailing ship violently attacks dolphins and seagulls at sea but encounters trouble when bombed by another pirate ship.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Real Story of Captain Cook's Death
results.brief_description:
Captain Cook encounters new territory and claims it. He is attacked by a native of the island and so flees. The native gets subsequently eaten by a big fish.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Australia - Colony to Nation
results.brief_description:
Australian Aboriginals sail down a river to be followed by white people from England. People from other nations begin to make their journeys to Australia and the film ends with the Olympic flag and people from all nationalities gathered around it.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: A Bulldog man
results.brief_description:
One of 6 works created in 2003 by community artist Malcolm McKinnon specifically for the MAP project. Each of the 6 works focuses on a different aspect of memory and identity in the Wimmera/Mallee region.
Lanz Bulldog tractors have been a big part of life in the Bolwell family since the 1930’s. Tim Bolwell has inherited his father’s collection of almost 30 Bulldog tractors, as well as an encyclopedic knowledge of the history and mechanics of these unusual machines. In this film, Tim explains the attraction of the Bulldog and its historical importance for many farmers in the Wimmera region.

results.title: The Finest of wheat
results.brief_description:
One of 6 works created in 2003 by community artist Malcolm McKinnon specifically for the MAP project. Each of the 6 works focuses on a different aspect of memory and identity in the Wimmera/Mallee region.
The late Don Wurfel was a farmer with an unusually keen interest in wheat breeding and the trialing of new crops for improved yields. Part of his legacy is an amazing collection of over 1500 grain varieties, most of which are housed at Wheatlands museum in Warracknabeal. In this film, Don’s son Ian talks about his father’s obsessive interest in new grain varieties and explains the importance of crop trialing for dryland farmers.
